name: Pineapple Sriracha Breakfast Bowls
description: Use up the leftovers in your fridge with these fast and tasty Pineapple Sriracha Breakfast Bowls. Easy and customizable to fit what you have on hand.Â

recipeInstructions.text: Reheat the cooked rice in the microwave, then season with soy sauce, sriracha, and a splash of sesame oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Reheat the cooked rice in the microwave, then season with soy sauce, sriracha, and a splash of sesame oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Roughly chop the pineapple pieces and thinly slice the green onion. Stir them into the seasoned rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Roughly chop the pineapple pieces and thinly slice the green onion. Stir them into the seasoned rice.

recipeInstructions.text: Fry the egg, seasoning it with salt and pepper, and leaving the yolk slightly runny. Top the seasoned rice bowl with the egg and enjoy.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry the egg, seasoning it with salt and pepper, and leaving the yolk slightly runny. Top the seasoned rice bowl with the egg and enjoy.

review.reviewBody: I keep a bag of frozen pineapple in the freezer now just for this recipe, as I often have the rest of the ingredients in my fridge.  I like this so much I don't just use it with leftover rice, but sometimes I make instant rice just so I can have it!
Just made it with canned pineapples, I may have overdone the siracha a little but it was so flavorful!! Looking forward to my breakfast this week!
This was delicious! I added half an avocado and some jalapeno pepper for an extra kick. I chose to refry the rice instead of microwaving it, and it turned out great!
This is SO TASTY!! I tried it out to use up leftover rice and we've had it a couple of times a week ever since. What a way to start the day :D

I had this for dinner last night and it was great! You should have more one serving meals. Even though, I live in an house with three adults, we all have very different dietary needs so having some quick single serving meals is always great to have. :)
I just tried this using leftover quinoa instead of rice and it was AWESOME!

This is my absolute favorite thing to make with leftover rice!  
I practically live on BudgetBytes.  Thanks :)

This was very good. i added some sliced Serrano peppers for a little extra heat.   I think I'll stir fry it a little bit in a skillet next time just for the heck of it..  Sesame oil and Sriracha or as I like to call them " nectar of the Gods".  THANKS for your site!

keywords: Breakfast Bowls, Fried Rice, How to Use Leftovers, Savory Breakfast Recipes
